definitions.example: We can't afford for the performance to run on for more than the specified time.

definitions.definition: To continue talking for a long time.
definitions.example: She ran on and wouldn't let anyone get a word in edgeways.

definitions.definition: To operate with a particular energy source.
To make numerous drafts or demands for payment, as upon a bank.
To carry on or continue (e.g. the type for a new sentence) without making a break or commencing a new paragraph.
To press with jokes or ridicule; to abuse with sarcasm; to bear hard on.
